Although Eric Schmidt said that he was happy with Google's decision to stop co-operating with China over censorship in March last year, he added: Over time I would hope, especially in my new role with more of an external focus, that I can try to get more of Google, appropriately and within our policies, into China. the official Google blog, Eric Schmidt said Larry Page will lead product development and technology strategy- his greatest strengths- and starting from April 4 will be in charge of Google's day-to-day operations as the CEO. I am enormously proud of my last decade as CEO, and I am certain that the next 10 years under Larry Page will be even better! Larry Page , in my clear opinion, is ready to lead, Eric Schmidt wrote. for the invasion of Iraq in a famous session of the UN Security Council and then, in Donald Rumsfeld 's words, claiming that he was`` somehow innocently misled into making a false declaration.'' Rumseld writes: Colin Powell was not duped or misled by anybody, nor did he lie about Saddam's suspected WMD stockpiles. The George W. Bush did not lie. The George H. W. Bush did not lie. Condoleezza Rice did not lie. I did not lie. The Congress did not lie. The far less dramatic truth is that we were wrong. Donald Rumsfeld , in his book, is particularly galled that Colin Powell issued an apology for the looting of Baghdad's Iraqi National Museum and vowed to recover stolen artifacts.
